data.title: Actors Born on February 5
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in film and TV for the 5th of February. Browse actors, actresses and directors that were born on February 5.
data.text:
Edward Rigby, British actor (Star Look Down, Young & Innocent), born in Ashford, Kent, England (d. 1951)

Bronislaw Kaper, Polish-American Academy Award-winning film composer (Green Dolphin Street; Lili; The Brothers Karamazov), born in Warsaw, Poland (d. 1983)

John Carradine, American actor (The Grapes of Wrath, Stagecoach, Howling), born in Greenwich Village, New York (d. 1988)

(Millicent) "Peg" Entwistle, British stage and screen actress, born in Port Talbot, Wales (d. 1932) [1]

Willard Parker, American actor (Kiss Me Kate, What A Woman), born in New York City (d. 1996)

Red Buttons [Aaron Chwatt], American comedian (The Red Buttons Show), and Academy Award-winning actor (Sayonara; The Poseidon Adventure), born in New York City (d. 2006)

1919 Tim Holt [Charles John Holt III], American actor (The Treasure of the Sierra Madre), born in Beverly Hills, California (d. 1973)

Frank Muir, British comedian (d. 1998)

Ken Adam, British film production designer (James Bond sets), born in Berlin, Germany (d. 2016)

Bernard Kalb, American journalist, moderator, lecturer and author, one of the most respected broadcast journalists of his time (CBS News, New York Times), born in New York City (d. 2023) [1] [2]

Val Dufour, American actor (Search for Tomorrow, 1972-79 - "John Wyatt"; Another World, 1967-72), born in New Orleans, Louisiana (d. 2000)

Nicholas Georgiade, American actor (Untouchables, Run Buddy Run), born in New York City (d. 2021)

Stuart Damon [Zonis], American stage and screen actor (General Hospital, 1977-2007 - "Dr. Alan Quartermaine"), born in Brooklyn, New York (d. 2021)

Jane Bryant Quinn, newscaster/financial writer (Everyone's Money Book), born in Niagara Falls, New York

David Selby, Morganstown WV, actor (Falcon Crest, Flamingo Road)

Michael Mann, American actor and director (Sexpot, Close Friends), born in Chicago, Illinois

Charlotte Rampling, English actress (Zardoz, Night Porter, Verdict), born in Sturmer, United Kingdom

1946 Mauro Pagani, Italian progressive rock violinist (Premiata Forneria Marconi (PFM)), and film soundtrack composer, born in Chiari, Lombardy, Italy

Darrell Waltrip

American auto racer (NASCAR Cup Series 1981, 82, 85; Daytona 500 1989; winner 84 x NASCAR Cup Series races) and broadcaster (Fox Sports), born in Owensboro, Kentucky

1947 David Ladd, American actor (Raymie, Catlow, Misty, Deathline), born in Los Angeles, California

Barbara Hershey [Herzstein], American actress (Stuntman, Shy People), born in Atlanta, Georgia

1948 Christopher Guest, American actor (SNL, 1984-85; This is Spinal Tap; The Princess Bride), and filmmaker (Best In Show; Waiting for Huffman), born in New York City

1948 Errol Morris, American documentary film director (The Thin Blue Line, The Fog of War: Eleven Lessons from the Life of Robert S. McNamara), born in Hewlett, New York

1948 Tom Wilkinson, English stage and screen BAFTA and Emmy Award-winning actor (The Full Monty; John Adams; Michael Clayton), born in Wharfedale, West Riding of Yorkshire, England (d. 2023) [1]

Cliff Martinez, American drummer (Captain Beefheart; Red Hot Chili Peppers, 1983-86), and film score composer (Spring Breakers; Sex, Lies, and Videotapes), born in the Bronx, New York

1954 Roseanne Katan, American model, actress and Playboy playmate (Sep 1978), born in New York City

Debra Jo Fondren, American model and actress, born in Los Angeles, California

Nick Laird-Clowes, English singer-songwriter (The Dream Academy - "Life in a Northern Town"), record producer, and film score composer, born in London, England

Tim Meadows, American actor and comedian, born in Highland Park, Michigan

Jennifer Jason Leigh [Morrow], American actress (Single White Female, Mrs. Parker and the Vicious Circle), born in Los Angeles, California

Steven Shainberg, American film director

Alexia Vassiliou, Cypriot singer and film score composer, born in Famagusta, Cyprus

1964 Laura Linney, American actress (The Truman Show, Mystic River), born in Manhattan, New York

Chris Parnell, American actor, born in Memphis, Tennessee

Eyþór Guðjónsson, Icelandic actor, born in Iceland

Michael Sheen, Welsh actor (Frost/Nixon), born in Newport, Wales

Marcus Redman, American actor (Raymond-Doogie Howser)

Koriki Chōshū, Japanese comedian, born in Tokyo, Japan

Diego Serrano, Ecuadorian-born American actor (Tomas Rivera-Another World), born in Quito, Ecuador

Adrienne Johnson, American basketball guard, administrator, broadcaster (WNBA Cleveland Rockers; University of Louisville), born in Louisville, Kentucky

1974 Omarosa Manigault Newman, American reality TV star & former political aide, born in Youngstown, Ohio

Alison Hammond, English TV presenter (Great British Bake Off), born in Birmingham, England

Abhishek Bachchan, Indian actor, born in Mumbai, India

1976 Tony Jaa, Thai actor and martial artist, born in Surin, Thailand

Shawn Reaves, American actor, born in Monroe, Louisiana

Mia Hansen-Løve, French film director and actress (Things to Come), born in Paris, France

1981 Nora Zehetner, American actress, born in El Paso, Texas

Crystal Hunt, American actress, born in Clearwater, Florida

1985 Lindsey Cardinale, American country music singer (American Idol, 2012), born in Hammond, Louisiana

Darren Criss, American actor (Glee: The Assassination of Gianni Versace), and singer-songwriter, born in San Francisco, California

1987 Henry Golding, Malaysian actor (Crazy Rich Asians), born in Betong, Sarawak, Malaysia

Cristine Reyes, Filipino actress, born in Marikina, Philippines

1989 Jeremy Sumpter, American actor (Peter Pan (2010), born in Carmel-by-the-Sea, California

Charlbi Dean [Kriek], South African actress (Spud films), born in Cape Town, South Africa (d. 2022)

Luke Newton, English actor, known for "Bridgerton", born in Shoreham-by-Sea, England
